item.title: European Union Finalizes New Pharmaceutical Framework to Enhance Industry Competitiveness and Supply Security
item.description: Top News European Union Finalizes New Pharmaceutical Framework to Enhance Industry Competitiveness and Supply Security 38 minutes ago The European Union has finalized a new pharmaceutical sector framework focused on enhancing industry competitiveness through two main approaches: reducing regulatory burdens on pharmaceutical companies and strengthening supply security mechanisms. The framework specifically addresses drug shortage prevention and management while streamlining regulatory processes to create a more efficient operating environment for manufacturers across EU member states.

item.title: TVS Supply Chain Solutions: Additional ₹120 Crore Worth Shares Pledged to Debenture Trustee
item.description: TVS Supply Chain Solutions: Additional ₹120 Crore Worth Shares Pledged to Debenture Trustee 3 hours ago TVS Supply Chain Solutions has pledged an additional 5 crore equity shares worth approximately ₹120 crores to Catalyst Trusteeship Limited as debenture trustee on December 8, 2025. Combined with an earlier pledge of 7 crore shares in April 2025, the total pledged shares now stand at 6.05 crore, representing 13.71% of the company's total share capital. The pledge serves as security for debenture holders including major financial institutions like J.P. Morgan Securities, Nomura Capital, and Kotak Private Credit Fund among others.

item.title: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Close in Red, IndiGo Crisis Deepens
item.description: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Close in Red, IndiGo Crisis Deepens 20 hours ago Indian stock markets ended negative, with Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex both down 0.32%. Market breadth favored decliners, with 2,382 stocks falling versus 2,166 advancing. IndiGo's operational crisis, Biocon's biologics consolidation, ICICI Bank's stake increase in its AMC, Infosys' Vietnam expansion, and Pine Labs' AI-powered bill pay feature were key highlights. The cautious sentiment was influenced by various corporate developments and global cues.

item.title: Seamec Secures USD 16.72 Million Vessel Charter Agreement with G R Infraprojects
item.description: Seamec Secures USD 16.72 Million Vessel Charter Agreement with G R Infraprojects 6 minutes ago Seamec Limited has officially announced a USD 16.72 million subcontract agreement with G R Infraprojects Limited for charter hire of vessel 'Seamec III' over 150 days. The contract involves subsea installation and diving operations for ONGC's pipeline replacement projects, representing a significant business development in the company's normal course of operations.
